title: Purplebricks' new boss confesses 'we really took our eye off the ball in the UK'
text:
The new boss of estate agent Purplebricks is a student of theology, but it’s his own shareholders who have had their faith tested lately.

The “hybrid” property seller – which combines online tech and on-the-ground self-employed agents – has had a dire year. In 2017, the firm was a bone fide “unicorn” with a valuation of more than £1bn.

But shares have slumped after a disastrous international expansion campaign, the founders have sold up, and the housing market is cooling. The stock is trading barely above its £1 float price four years ago, putting a price tag of just £340m on the business.

In with the task of sweeping up this mess since May is the 46-year-old Vic Darvey, who meets me in the headquarters...
description: The new boss of estate agent Purplebricks is a student of theology, but it’s his own shareholders who have had their faith tested lately.
